description: Probably from Low German and Dutch snuffelen (“to snuffle”), equivalent to snuff +‎ -le.

entries.meaning: An act of snuffling; sniffing loudly

verbs.description: snuffle (third-person singular simple present snuffles, present participle snuffling, simple past and past participle snuffled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To sniff or smell with the nose loudly and audibly.
(intransitive) To speak through the nose; to breathe through the nose when it is obstructed, so as to make a broken sound.
